{"id":1805507706,"question_id":4020,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"4 weeks, 2 days","timestamp":1760843145,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1805507706/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Lexicographically Smallest Permutation Greater Than Target","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    string lexGreaterPermutation(string s, string target) {\n        int N = (int)s.size();\n        unordered_map<char, int> m;\n        for (char c : s) \n            m[c]++;\n\n        string ans = \"\";\n        bool ok = false;\n        for (int i=0; i<N; i++) {\n            if (ok) {\n                for (char c='a'; c<='z'; c++) {\n                    if (m[c] > 0) {\n                        m[c]--;\n                        ans.push_back(c);\n                        break;\n                    }\n                }\n                \n            } else {\n                for (char c=target[i]; c<='z'; c++) {\n                    if (m[c] > 0) {\n                        m[c]--;\n                        ans.push_back(c);\n                        if (c > target[i])\n                            ok = true;\n                        break;\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n            if ((int)ans.size() != i+1) \n                return \"\";\n        }\n\n        return ans > target ? ans : \"\";\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"lexicographically-smallest-permutation-greater-than-target","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1,"frontend_id":1277}
